problem.markdown:
>>Nitrogen is important to living organisms because it:<<
( ) can help clean up the environment through photosynthesis ( ) can be used as a substitute for petroleum fuels (x) is used to form amino acids, the building blocks for proteins ( ) is less than 10% of the atmosphere ( ) contributes to the decomposition of organisms
[explanation]
Nitrogen is an essential component of amino acids--the building blocks of proteins--and of nucleotides, which make up DNA. Therefore, it is needed by all living things.
[explanation]
